</font><font color="#00FFFF">Rear exit of the Temple
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are in a small dank passage with barely enough light to see by.  The
walls are made from unpolished marble.  Torches are in sconces in the walls, but
are covered in dust and appear not to have been lit in years.  The wall to the
north appears to be a carefully constructed doorway that leads outside the
temple.  A small oaken door stands to the south.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Surrounded by grasslands
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">    The grasslands surround you on all sides.  Tall grasses of all kinds are
growing.  Shorter grasses with a goldenrod fluff at their tips.  Grasses
with green and yellow variegated leaves, and tall stalks of a deep green
with a bamboo like appearance.  The grasslands continue to the north, east,
and south.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">North end of the grasslands
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are at the northern end of the grasslands.  Tall grasses of all kinds are
growing.  Shorter grasses with a goldenrod fluff at their tips.  Grasses with
green and yellow variegated leaves, and tall stalks of a deep green with a

grasslands continue to the west and south.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">At the top of a deep shaft
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Standing atop a deep shaft in the dark cave, you peer down into the hole and
can make out the bottom about twenty feet below you.  Fortunately for you, a
ladder has been placed here by some wise adventurer and it appears to be sturdy
enough to handle the weight of a half-giant if needed.  Who knows what awaits
you down there?  Perhaps you will find a long lost treasure trove, or maybe
there will be a horde of goblins waiting to jump out of the shadows and end your
adventures right there.  Just west of here you can see the entrance to the cave
winding its way out towards the Astyll Hills.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">At the bottom of a deep shaft
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   The bottom of the shaft opens up a world hidden from the eyes of all but the
most brave of adventurers.  Stalagmites and stalactites meet one another in a
crescendo of beauty that many fearful city inhabitants will never get to see.  
A well trodden path winds its way south through the cave, as though some
creature or creatures have inhabited this cave at some point.  Perhaps they
still dwell here, or perhaps this path is the last remaining evidence of a
people long gone from an age that came and went.  A sturdy wooden ladder reaches
down from above you, offering a way out of the cave should you choose to take
it.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">A path through the cave
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You find yourself on a narrow path through the nearly innumerable number of
stalagmites and stalactites that blanket the floor and ceiling of the cave.  An
eerie silence, void of the crickets, birds, and various animals from the surface
world comforts you by allowing you to hear any potential movement within the
cave.  From time to time you hear the fluttering of wings above you, but it is
too dark to make out any discernible figures.  The path forks in a three-way
intersection.  Directly north of here, a deep shaft can be seen overhead.  The
path continues to snake along to the east and west.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">A winding path
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You find yourself on a narrow path through the nearly innumerable number of
stalagmites and stalactites that blanket the floor and ceiling of the cave.  An
eerie silence, void of the crickets, birds, and various animals from the surface
world comforts you by allowing you to hear any potential movement within the
cave.  From time to time you hear the fluttering of wings above you, but it is
too dark to make out any discernible figures.  A narrow passage may be seen to
the west.  Off to the north a long corridor catches your eye.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">A turn in the cave
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   The twisting passage turns slightly here, bobbing and weaving its way through
the cave.  The limestone walls are smooth and show evidence of erosion
throughout the ages.  Steady, horizontal striations of gradually darkening lines
indicate that water once sat for long periods of time in this chamber.  The
tunnel opens up to a cavernous chamber further along the path to the west.  
North of here the path narrows as it twists and winds it way through the cave
system.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">An open cavern
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   A wide, open cavern splits in three directions here.  Off to the north a
cramped tunnel extends onwards towards an unknown destination.  Rocks and
boulders are strewn about to the east, clearly an indicator that the ceiling has
collapsed and settled safely upon the cave floor.  While moving east does not
present any immediate danger from the cave surroundings, off to the west the
cavern extends itself and pools of crystal clear water can be seen.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">A spacious cavern
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Fluttering wings can be heard all around you accompanied by the random, yet
constant sound of animals chirping in the darkness above.  Crystal clear water
gather along the edges of the path, forming a series of underground pools that
are teaming with life in this delicate habitat.  Far in the distance to the
east, the cavern widens and there appears to be an intersection that provides
different ways in which you can travel.  Just to the west of here the cavern
walls begin to press in upon themselves as it narrows.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">A winding path through the cave
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   The narrow cave path snakes along, weaving through the various mineral
deposits that have seeped through the rocky ceiling above you over the ages.  
Piles of a milky-white substance litter the area all around you, inviting you to
inspect them for clues about what may or may not live in the cave.  The path
continues to the north, while a small hole can be seen in the cave wall to the
west.

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">n
</font><font color="#00FFFF">A winding path through the cave
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You find yourself on a narrow path through the nearly innumerable number of
stalagmites and stalactites that blanket the floor and ceiling of the cave.  An
eerie silence, void of the crickets, birds, and various animals from the surface
world comforts you by allowing you to hear any potential movement within the
cave.  From time to time you hear the fluttering of wings above you, but it is
too dark to make out any discernible figures.  The shaft leading out of the cave
lies to the east.  To the south of you the winding path continues into the
darkened cave system.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">A path through the cave
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You find yourself on a narrow path through the nearly innumerable number of
stalagmites and stalactites that blanket the floor and ceiling of the cave.  An
eerie silence, void of the crickets, birds, and various animals from the surface
world comforts you by allowing you to hear any potential movement within the
cave.  From time to time you hear the fluttering of wings above you, but it is
too dark to make out any discernible figures.  The path forks in a three-way
intersection.  Directly north of here, a deep shaft can be seen overhead.  The
path continues to snake along to the east and west.

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">n
</font><font color="#00FFFF">At the bottom of a deep shaft
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   The bottom of the shaft opens up a world hidden from the eyes of all but the
most brave of adventurers.  Stalagmites and stalactites meet one another in a
crescendo of beauty that many fearful city inhabitants will never get to see.  
A well trodden path winds its way south through the cave, as though some
creature or creatures have inhabited this cave at some point.  Perhaps they
still dwell here, or perhaps this path is the last remaining evidence of a
people long gone from an age that came and went.  A sturdy wooden ladder reaches
down from above you, offering a way out of the cave should you choose to take
it.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">A winding path
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You find yourself on a narrow path through the nearly innumerable number of
stalagmites and stalactites that blanket the floor and ceiling of the cave.  An
eerie silence, void of the crickets, birds, and various animals from the surface
world comforts you by allowing you to hear any potential movement within the
cave.  From time to time you hear the fluttering of wings above you, but it is
too dark to make out any discernible figures.  A narrow passage may be seen to
the west.  Off to the north a long corridor catches your eye.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">A turn in the cave
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   The twisting passage turns slightly here, bobbing and weaving its way through
the cave.  The limestone walls are smooth and show evidence of erosion
throughout the ages.  Steady, horizontal striations of gradually darkening lines
indicate that water once sat for long periods of time in this chamber.  The
tunnel opens up to a cavernous chamber further along the path to the west.  
North of here the path narrows as it twists and winds it way through the cave
system.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">An open cavern
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   A wide, open cavern splits in three directions here.  Off to the north a
cramped tunnel extends onwards towards an unknown destination.  Rocks and
boulders are strewn about to the east, clearly an indicator that the ceiling has
collapsed and settled safely upon the cave floor.  While moving east does not
present any immediate danger from the cave surroundings, off to the west the
cavern extends itself and pools of crystal clear water can be seen.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Standing above a shallow shaft
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   The shaft continues downwards, further into the heart of the dark cave
system.  Carved by water flowing over the rocky cave structure over time, it is

should find its way here to slowly drain during the Midgaard rainy season.  An

</font><font color="#00FFFF">A turn in the cave
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Calcium deposits dot the ground beneath your feat, drippings from the ceiling
that have settled here over the ages.  Unlike other areas of this cave, the dirt
here is bone dry, almost chalky as though water had never touched it since the
dawn of creation.  To the south a pool of water springs up from nowhere, but to
the east the dusty ground continues.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">The dusty corridor
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Bats swoop you from time to time as you venture deeper into the cave.  There

</font><font color="#00FFFF">The dusty corridor
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Each step you take leaves clearly marked imprints upon the ground, and

what lurks around here, but the footprints do veer off towards the south into
what looks like a tight-fitting burrow of some sort.

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Up ahead to the north you spot what looks like a turn in the passageway,

awful!

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">w
</font><font color="#00FFFF">Entrance to the Den
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Bones from various animals and creatures are strewn about the cave floor.  
Tattered and ragged clothes can be seen everywhere, some mingled with large
piles of dung while others lay upon the floor in random places.  Whatever
creature has made this den their home is surely carnivorous, and you would hate
to find yourself winding up being eaten by it.  An overwhelming odor from the
various dropping lingers in the air, a rank and apparent indicator that the
creature which has made this their home frequents this place regularly.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">The Den of the Bear
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   As you enter the den you are immediately struck by the familiar smell of
death.  Unlike other parts of the cave, the ground here is relatively dry and
the steady temperature of the air around you is cool.  As you search around the
cave you stumble upon a long, white bone and notice a familiar site.  The
noticeably recognizable equipment of numerous Astyll Rangers litters the floor,
their skeletons strewn about randomly.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">The dusty corridor
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Each step you take leaves clearly marked imprints upon the ground, and
judging by the looks of it, you are not alone.  It would appear that several

indicate.  They could be old, or perhaps they are fresh.  There's no telling

what looks like a tight-fitting burrow of some sort.

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Calcium deposits dot the ground beneath your feat, drippings from the ceiling

the east the dusty ground continues.

plummeting downward into the underground crevasse.  After what seems like an

</font><font color="#00FFFF">North end of the grasslands
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are at the northern end of the grasslands.  Tall grasses of all kinds are

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Hacking through the thicket
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Driven by a desire you cannot discern, you hack your way into the midst
of a dense, overgrown thicket.  It appears to extend many acres, cutting
off the land from whence you came for centuries.  Some of the branchs and
vine-stalks that harrow your passage through here seem to be younger and
weaker.  Perhaps a little bit of determination will find you a way through
this mess.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">The Heart of the Astyll Hills
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">    You are in the heart of the Astyll Hills.  Rolling hills stretch in all 
directions.  Far to the north and east there are mountains on the horizon.
Your view to the northwest is blocked by a large bluff.  Far to the south 
it appears the Astyll Hills are bordered by forests.  Meandering paths lead 
to the north and south.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">A Path in the Astyll Hills
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">    You are on a path climbing up the tallest bluff in the Astyll Hills region.
The west side of the bluff is a sheer face which drops 50 feet straight
down into the golden yellow grasslands below.  The hills continue to the 
east, until they become large mountains.  To the southwest is a large city.  
To the north you see a great bonfire raging on the plateau at 
the top of this hill.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">The Turning Point
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   The trees stand close here, and the tall, bushy undergrowth prevents you from
seeing far in any direction save north, where a broad lane leads off into the
distance; and west, where the same lane continues towards what looks like a
fairly large city.  The muted sounds of city commotion reach your ears from a
distance; stray dogs barking, children crying, and street salesmen shouting.
